title: Drunk burglar caught sleeping on sofa after breaking into cafe
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A drunk burglar was caught by police passed out on a sofa after breaking into a cafe and stealing Newcastle Brown Ale.

David Unsworth, 38, helped himself to snacks and downed bottles of alcohol before deciding to have a rest.

CCTV caught him smashing a window at Great Coffee on Newcastle’s Quayside, then crawling inside at 4am on October 14.

He took cash from the till before taking bottles from the fridge.

But his fatal mistake was to take a break on the sofa.

Several hours later, a passing police officer spotted the broken window hours later and found Unsworth still asleep inside.

David Unsworth, 38, was caught on CCTV (Picture: North News)

He fell asleep at the scene (Picture: North News)

Now Unsworth, of Gateshead, has been jailed for 30 weeks after he admitted burglary of a commercial premises at Bedlington Magistrates’ Court yesterday.

He was also sentenced for a string of other offences.

Chief Inspector Steve Wykes, of Northumbria Police, said: ‘The officers on patrol were very proactive and when they saw something that didn’t look quite right they acted.

‘It may seem comical but it was down to their vigilance that they were able to find Unsworth inside the premises.

‘The fact he was fast asleep made it pretty easy for us to detain him but I guess committing a burglary can be tiring work.

‘He is spending time behind bars where he will be able to enjoy as much sleep as he wants from now on.

‘I want to praise those officers who attended for taking quick action that could ultimately have prevented financial loss to that business.

‘I hope their actions gives the public confidence that the city is in safe hands.’
